item.title: Despite Media Hype, No Bounce for Obama in Swing States
item.description: Despite Media Hype, No Bounce for Obama in Swing States: Politico’s “Unnamed Sources” say Ohio is lost for Mitt ... http://t.co/xVPeKOQz
item.content:encoded: Despite Media Hype, No Bounce for Obama in Swing States: Politico’s “Unnamed Sources” say Ohio is lost for Mitt ... http://t.co/xVPeKOQz Whatever bounce Obama got was in the blue states. In the swing states, it’s still way too close to call. Today’s Rasmussen poll results show that in the eleven swing states, including Colorado, Florida, Iowa, Michigan, Nevada, New Hampshire, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Virginia and Wisconsin, which total 145 electoral votes, it’s Obama 46% and Romney 45%. In 2008, Obama won these states 53% to 46%. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: breitbart.com

item.description: Worse Than Solyndra: Obama Admin Buying Maine Senate Seat with Crony Energy Loans http://t.co/q3wjILyK via @sharethis
item.content:encoded: Worse Than Solyndra: Obama Admin Buying Maine Senate Seat with Crony Energy Loans http://t.co/q3wjILyK via @sharethis The Obama administration is famous for its crony capitalism. It’s famous for wasting money on disastrous investments like Solyndra to pay off its political allies. It now appears, however, that they go a step further: they put public funds in bad investment loans, then double down on their bad loans with free cash grants. Link - Trackbacks

item.content:encoded: Tips on building a FB page for a cause as @jackiesbuzz and I are with @DolphinsLoveUs: About 15 months ago my fr... http://t.co/xNGPviDt About 15 months ago my friend Jackie and I decided to collaborate on a “message” cause about dolphins. We had long been passionate about protecting these amazing creatures and wanted to bring awareness in a unique and positive way. Many people were protesting strongly about what is happening to dolphins in Japan but we did not just want to “protest” to bring awareness. Link - Trackbacks

item.title: GoDaddy Outage Takes Down Millions Of Sites, Anonymous Member Claims Responsibility | TechCrunch
item.description: GoDaddy Outage Takes Down Millions Of Sites http://t.co/ne2Mr7gG by @klintron
item.content:encoded: GoDaddy Outage Takes Down Millions Of Sites http://t.co/ne2Mr7gG by @klintron According to many customers, sites hosted by major web host and domain registrar GoDaddy are down. According to the official GoDaddy Twitter account the company is aware of the issue and is working to resolve it. Update: customers are complaining that GoDaddy hosted e-mail accounts are down as well, along with GoDaddy phone service and all sites using GoDaddy's DNS service. Update 2: Anonymous is claiming responsibility. A member of Anonymous known as AnonymousOwn3r is claiming responsibility, and makes it clear this is not an Anonymous collective action. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: techcrunch.com
